title: FS: T207 Tannehill in Comiskey Park Wood Frame
author: oldirtyfishkilla

posts.post_title: FS: T207 Tannehill in Comiskey Park Wood Frame
posts.post_content:
Hi all,

I'm offering a freshly dressed up T207 Lee Tannehill framed and matted in a 4x6" frame madE by myself.

The frame is made from a Comiskey Park seat bottom slat that I had-cut, routed and put together myself. It is comes with a COA from myself stating how it was made and numbered 6 of 8 in first series of these that I did. It also will come with a COA from Authentic Stadium Seats where I bought the seat bottom. All materials are archival and a UV blocking sheet had been put between Mr. Tannehill and the glass. 

The card itself is in PR/FR condition with some paper loss but please see photos to draw your own condition conclusion. 

Asking $90.00 paypal or best offer... Please see photos and ask questions.
I have other stadium frames in 5x7 and 8x10 sizes...
[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=97133&d=1366854181[/IMG]

Love the project, dirty! Very cool!

Thanks bb!

I'll be posting larger ones later on in the Memorabilia and/or auction section when I finally have some time off.

I have Forbes Field, Comiskey Park, Yankee Stadium, Wrigley Field, The Polo Grounds and Heritage park...
BUMP Before I  move it somewhere else...

[quote name="oldirtyfishkilla" post=1123985]BUMP Before I  move it somewhere else...[/QUOTE]

  This is a very cool piece. Please give me a heads up whenever you put up the Forbes Field one. I rarely check the auction or memorabilia sections, only when the last post catches my eye on the main page
